name: iteration
description: Define and enforce the repo-native iteration contract for agents.

sections.title: Skill â€” Iteration Contract Builder
lines: Purpose: Define and enforce the repo-native iteration contract for agents.

sections.title: Rules
bullets: Execution is allowed when required by an iteration stage or explicitly requested.
Ask for confirmation before destructive actions (delete, overwrite, reset, uninstall).
Read `docs/_feedback.md` as the source of review tasks.
Steps MUST be bounded, deterministic, and have explicit inputs/outputs.
Never mutate intent. Only propose changes via artifacts.
Mark review items resolved by updating the resolution log in `docs/_feedback.md`.
When generating a root workflow, pause and present a preview for user approval before any child workflow work.

sections.title: Workflow Schema Requirements
bullets: `workflow.bounded_work` must include: max_steps_per_iteration, max_files_per_step, max_new_files_per_iteration, max_move_operations_per_step, extract_child_workflow_if_any_exceeded.
Step `status` must be one of: planned, in_progress, done, blocked.
Step `actions` must use CLI primitives: read, write, validate, report, execute, capture.

sections.title: Extraction Gate (2+ YES => child workflow)
bullets: Task has distinct deliverables that can be independently reviewed.
Task spans multiple domains likely to exceed one-exec scope.
Task needs commands outside the allowed command surface or extra validation.

sections.title: Allowed Command Surface
bullets: Discover available CLI commands at runtime (e.g., `dev.kit --list` or `--help`) before invoking them.
Use only commands that are explicitly available in the current environment.
Ask for confirmation before destructive commands (delete, overwrite, reset, uninstall).

sections.title: How to Consume `docs/_feedback.md`
bullets: Identify unresolved items by task ID (e.g., DOC-002, MF-001).
Preserve original task language; only add structured workflow steps.
If the task is ambiguous, emit a `request` output.

sections.title: Iteration Routing
bullets: If the prompt is "iteration" or explicitly requests iteration, run the iteration stages.
If the prompt exceeds the bounded-work limits or spans distinct deliverables, generate a workflow using the prompt-as-workflow approach and return a workflow artifact.
Use `.udx/dev.kit/workflows/<task-id>/workflow.md` for parent workflows and `.udx/dev.kit/workflows/<parent>/<child>/index.md` for children.
Defer child workflow creation until the parent step is iterated.

sections.title: Resolution Log Update
bullets: Append a resolution entry with task ID, file path(s), and summary.

sections.title: Done Criteria
bullets: No outstanding questions for the task.
